intro: Sison segetum, commonly known as the field sison, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Sison segetum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
